reviewText: It is a European movie where you have to give the story time to develop. I thoroughly enjoyed this movie. Mathias Vergels was electric. The other characters in the movie came alive with some very good performances by all - they were not a mere backdrop to the movie, they mattered and made you care about them one way or the other. This is a new genre of gay themed movie much like Stadt Land Fluss. Nice to see that in such movies you do not have to spend half of it watching the actors in bed or trying to get into bed, there other ways to create romance and tension. Great movie indeed.

reviewText: While the coming-of-age story has been told many times before (and will continue to be told), this film does a sweet and sensitive justice to the yearning for love and desire.  Our young lead (Pim) longs for his older friend Gino.  When the two young lives intersect one day in the garage, Pim dreams of something far greater.  But the reality turns cold for Pim as Gino shy's away from any emotional connection to Pim.When you consider films of a similar story line that have come before (Beautiful Thing,Summer Storm,Edge of Seventeen), this one is well done, but not one that will stand out in my long list of favorite movies.  That said, it turns strong performances from the young male leads, the two mothers, and most of the supporting cast.  It's believable, and Pim's character is one the viewer can connect with and embrace.This is essentially a coming-of-age drama, that tends to slow down in the second half of the film as lives become unraveled.  Unlike my other favorites referenced above, you won't find much (if anything) to laugh about in this film.  I didn't find myself grasped by the storyline, nor would I watch it a second time.  However, it's well worth your time, and at least the ending won't leave you feeling depressed.  I'm glad I took the time to watch, and think you'll find an endearing film, and a character many an adult can recall from his (or her) own youth.
summary: Youthful Unrequited Love in this Coming of Age Tale

reviewText: "Could you not tell anyone we've done this," were the favored words of the men with whom I lay.When I wrote that sentence in my semi-autobiographic book, "Gay Teenage Wasteland Library Edition", I hoped I was among a select minority.  Yet, upon hearing the post-intercourse edict spoken in "North Sea Texas", I realize the sentiment is an all too prevalent confession of shame among gay males and their closeted sexual partners.  In reality, most of these encounters become segues to silence, but in the film, "North Sea Texas", there is a rare portrayal of contentment in the inhabitance of one's own skin and sexuality.The cinematography of the movie is lush, and its actors are beautiful.  Well crafted and worthwhile viewing for fans of any film genre.
summary: Don't Tell Anyone We've Done This

reviewText: This isn't the easiest review to write. My emotions are mixed on this one. I love the film, I just wish I understood all of it. It was difficult for me to follow. Perhaps it is the language barrier, or moreso the cultural barrier I suppose. The film is in Dutch with English subtitles, and while the English translation is fine where the words are concerned, perhaps the culture doesn't quite get translated. If I were Dutch I might understand it better, but to an American there is a lot here that is very much foreign and more difficult to follow.The story is rather simple but there were places that just lost me. The beginning made little sense until several minutes into the film. Don't be impatient. Stay with it and give the film a chance to draw you into it's plot. A very handsome lead actor: Jelle Florizoone, plays as "Pim" a boy who has grown up in the home of a single mother who has issues of her own and is more concerned about her own happiness than the general welfare of her child. Pim is a very quiet young man who lives in a world all his own. He rarely opens up to anyone, and dreams a lot about the love and affection that has never really been a reality in his life. The object of his attractions is the equally handsome "Gino".The attraction is quite obviously mutual, but Gino (very well portrayed by Mathias  Vergels), being older, is a lot more outgoing and open to explore other possibilities. The two hit it off quite well and share a beautiful, erotic relationship which defines to Pim everything he has always dreamed of. For Gino however, it's just not the romance of a lifetime. His search for love is a little more uncertain, and will take time and exploration to figure out who he is and what he truly longs for.Meanwhile Gino's little sister Sabrina has fallen head over heels for Pim, until she uncovers the truth of his affection for her brother. Gino and Sabrina's mother, also a single parent, takes Pim under her wing to show him the love and understanding that she alone seems to realize he has never known. Mom also seems to understand a bit more about Pim and Gino than they might expect. She is also very ill and soon these three may be left to figure things out without her guidance.The acting is SUPERB all the way around. Florizoone is not only visually appealing to the camera, but his acting is right on target with the character he portrays. A haunting look at the life of a child who has somehow managed to grow up without the guidance of a father and with a mother who needs as much parenting as he does. Very well directed and I do recommend this film for your viewing pleasure.I'm a bit disappointed as the film didn't quite live up to my expectations and I feel an English version might have made a little more sense in spots and made the whole plot more enjoyable to watch. Keep in mind it is a foreign film and don't expect more than it can deliver. You will fall in love with Pim and be rooting for a happy ending. The ending is good and to this reviewer, that caries an awful lot of weight! Definitely worth watching.
summary: And did you know that Pim and Gino.........

reviewText: A thrill to get this sent to me after paying to see it through instant video! The emotions built slowly into many-a-gay-man's reality when he was a boy in this beautifully and artfully framed film that surprisingly included convincing actors to boot. A dream to see actual young boys in these gay parts with tastefully shot scenes that leave some, completion to the imagination, otherwise, it would need to be filed as a porno flick. I had to cry while it neared completion as it painted such a great picture of our gay longings to love another male but have to put up with barriers that keep us from having what our souls are bleeding for. I sure wish it was an English soundtrack but the Dutch language was not too fast for me, making it nearly always easy to read the English subtitles. Backing it up now and then on my computer helped.
summary: OLD GAY MAN NOW BUT THIS CINEMA MADE ME TEAR UP BECAUSE IT WAS SO BEAUTIFULLY EXECUTED

reviewText: Amazon recommended this film to people who liked "Spetters," and it's easy to see the similarities: Dutch, boys, motorcycle(s), and sex.  But, "Spetters" is "Iron Man III" compared to this film!North Sea Texas is very beautiful; not just the boys but everything; even the gritty seaside town (population: 8?) is very beautiful.  If you watch the Amazon HD download on a huge TV, you will, at least, enjoy this.But talk about slow!  This movie was so slow, it was riveting in its slowness.  Conflict?  The plot could have been written on a postcard - and you'd still have room for your return address.There seems to be a certain belief that every gay youth movie is a breakthrough.  This may have been true 30 years ago, but couldn't we have more gay youth films with the excitement and action of "Spetters" - and not just the beauty of a Monet?

reviewText: I really liked this movie, although I wish it had been in English rather than Dutch since the movie took place in Texas. The other boy (Nino) is a few years orlder than him about years.  It was on the youngest boy's 15th birthday the two boys had their first experience.  The youngest boy's mother was a tramp and eventually took off with a young man (gypsy) permanently.  Meanwhile he went to live at his friend's Nino's house where he was welcomed.  Nino's Mother was deadly sick with kidney problems.  As she died in the hospital she took each boys hands and put them together (what a beautiful gesture symbolizing for them to be together.  A very nice movie with a short limited staff but good story and acting.  RENT IT.

reviewText: At the beginning of the movie Pim is around 10-years-old and is playing in his mother's bedroom. At one time Pim's mother was apparently a beauty queen and Pim puts on her crown, sash and necklace. When his mother catches him he is wearing the crown, the sash, the necklace, and nothing else. (I will point out that although he quickly covers his genitals with his hands when she comes into the room, it actually did not matter because the sash was already covering them.)After getting dressed he runs to a nearby house where another single mother lives with her two children; Gino who is about two years older than Pim, and Sabrina who is about a year younger than Pim.Ten minutes into the movie it jumps forward in time to the day before Pim's 15th birthday, which he spends with the nearby family. His mother has left him home alone while going out of town with a man. This is where the true storyline begins to develop. It is easy to see that Sabrina is smitten with Pim, but with the help of a flash back we see that Pim is smitten with Gino. It is the night before Pim turns 15 that Pim and Gino's relationship turns truly sexual. (The flash back has sexual overtones, but no sex between them.)The movie continues from here over a few years following the relationships between Pim and Gino, Pim and Sabrina, Gino and a girlfriend he eventually moves in with, as well as Pim's mother's relationship with men. The storyline also develops a back story about Gino and Sabrina's father.There are other complications and interweaving of the storyline which I will not get into because I don't want to give to much away for those who have not seen the movie. I will add that the movie does not include any sex scenes. But the movie leaves no doubt that it takes place.

reviewText: This is the best film I've seen about a gay kid trying to negotiate his way through a difficult life.  Such movies tend to be wildly, unrealistically optimistic (BEAUTIFUL THING, a fine film in its way but definitely a fantasy) or polemic (GET REAL, another good film, but more politically satisfying that realistically convincing).  NORTH SEA TEXAS avoids both pitfalls, and its gentle realism provides a nuanced, tender look at its young protagonist's life.  One thing I found especially striking is the fact that young Pim and his boyfriend are working class kids (one is an auto mechanic), and they have nothing to do with mainstream gay culture (no bars, discos, Pride marches or what-have-you).  In gay film, this is all but unheard-of, and it's incredibly refreshing.  I can't recommend this film highly enough.

reviewText: The Belgian coming-of-age tale "North Sea Texas" might not win any awards for originality as you're certain to have seen dozens of films to follow a similar story arc.  Despite its familiarity, though, it still works as an exploration of the sexual and romantic awakening of an awkward teen stranded in a desolate seaside village.  Before going any further, let me clarify that Bavo Defurne's debut feature is NOT set in Texas.  While I think this would be perfectly clear from the description, I just thought that I would mention it as the prospect of subtitles seems to put off certain viewers.  But, as they say, love is universal.  And the yearning and emotions inherent throughout "North Sea Texas" are sure to resonate with anyone who has ever had a crush or experienced the complications of first love.The boy at the center of "North Sea Texas" is Pim (Jelle Florizoone).  Although we glimpse a younger version of Pim in the movie's opening sequence, the narrative covers about three years as he reaches adulthood.  Living with his single mother, who likes her evenings out, Pim has taken on the mantle of responsibility around the homestead.  Aloof and introspective, drawing is his passion.  But, like most, he is looking for someone with whom to share his interests and desires.  Improbably, an older neighborhood boy named Gino (Mathias Vergels) becomes the object of Pim's adoration.  As the two boys share in some youthful indiscretions, it seems only a matter of time before Gino stretches toward his own independence and livelihood.  Pim is left to deal with the change in their relationship as well as a number of other issues in his family life.  Though the screenplay focuses primarily on Pim, his mother, a returning lodger, and Gino's family also come to affect the boy's maturation.Again, it's easy to identify with the themes in "North Sea Texas."  One of the reasons that films keep depicting similar coming-of-age stories is that there is an underlying truthfulness in the shared experience of growing up.  Everyone has had unrequited feelings, everyone has been flush with happiness and idealism, and everyone has even had a broken heart or two.  I liked the understated approach of "North Sea Texas" and the fact that much of the movie dealt with Pim's struggles in rather subtle ways.  There aren't big speeches or bold dramatic moments, most of the changes that occur in Pim's life do so silently or off screen.  The camera zooms in close to Pim as he processes and/or reacts to what has happened, but very little is verbalized.  I didn't wholeheartedly buy the movie's ending, but I was happy enough to go along for the ride.  Sometimes funny, sometimes heartbreaking, "North Sea Texas" touched me even if it didn't particularly suprise me.  KGHarris, 2/13.
summary: Effective And Emotional: A Thoughtful Coming-of-Age Story From Belgium

reviewText: Jelle Florizoone's portrayal of the teenage Pim is brilliant. His darting eyes take in everything: his mother's childish and irresponsible behavior, his friend's sister's obsession with him, the sexiness of the gypsy Zoltan, and so forth. Nothing escapes him, and nothing protects him from hurt. Both he and his best friend Gino each lives in a fatherless family. At first the duo is inseparable, and make love, but since Gino is three years older, he soon begins a relationship with Franoise, and abandons younger Pim. This breaks his heart. Gino's mother, who has kidney problems, takes pity on Pim and invites him to come live with her when the boy's mother runs off with the gypsy. Pim sleeps in Gino's room. But the mother is soon hospitalized, and just before she dies, she takes Gino's hand and places it in Pim's. Amazingly sensitive and compassionate, compared to the "action picture" crop of junk we get here. Think back to your adolescence and remember how you suffered when someone you loved didn't return your feelings. Mr. Florizoone's beautiful face perfectly registers every disappointment and heartbreak visited upon him. It won't be long before he is recognized as the great actor he is. Bravo. Five stars.

reviewText: What a sweet little movie this is.Well, actually, bittersweet might be a more accurate description.  It is a story of love and fantasy between 15yo Pim in Holland and his 18yo neighbor, Gino.  The older boy is handsome and seductive and they share a lovely, secret romance until Gino meets a girl.There are other interesting characters:  Pim's mother is an overweight, former beauty queen who is a part-time singer.  She shares one thing with her son:  they both dream of love and a better life.Gino's mother is ill but the family takes Pim under their wing.  Gino's teenage sister complicates things a bit when she falls for Pim who cannot requite her love.This would be a five-star film (lovely young actors, interesting script, nice cinematography) except for a couple of production problems.  About 80% of the subtitles are indecipherable being white with no outline, so, all too often they blend with a light background and cannot be read at all, or only in part.  The story is fairly straight-forward but, still, this is quite an unnecessary annoyance.  Even at the end, during over four minutes of closing credits against a black background, not one word is readable as the font it so small -- and I have a large screen!A disappointed and rejected Pim finally destroys all his kept treasures of Gino.  But, just after, Gino reappears because of a family tragedy and it looks as though they have a more realistic hope of a true love instead of a teenage fantasy.
summary: five stars except for one thing

reviewText: It's nice to see an intelligent, compassionate film about a young gay boy finding love in a very positive, supportive society (NOT in Texas, by the way, as the title might suggest, but in Belgium, where gay marriage has been legal for some time). But I (for one) found the young leading man in this film one of the dullest young actors I've ever seen. Perhaps he's deliberately so, since the character he plays is baleful, moody, and spiteful: altogether a real pill. But (the movie suggests) even a "pill" can find love in Belgium. The British film BEAUTIFUL THING covers the same topography with a much more sympathetic protagonist and an ebulliant score featuring Mama Cass recordsings. [If you must see it, get an All-Region DVD player from Philips and start buying your foreign films from British Amazon for a fraction of the price scalpers charge you as middle-men.]

reviewText: The story of two boys is an isolated area of Belgian coast. His mother is a floozy who has time to play music and flirt with men, but little time for her son. Pim, the lead character, has a friend in the son (Gino) of a neighbor who takes care of him while is mother is gone. Once Pin  turns 15, apparently the legal age in that country, he and Gino begin ...what... it is hard to describe... adolescent sexual exploration, friends with benefits. At this young age such a thing can only turn bad. Gino, I think partly because of social expectation, turns his attention to a girl making Pim jealous.Though there are other conflicts in the film, the primary source of conflict is Pim and Gino's unresolved feelings for each other.I enjoyed this film and actually bought a copy rather than watching it from a streaming service. I think both Netflix and Amazon have this movie available for streaming. I found it thoroughly engaging. Though somewhat low budget. Still, excellent acting by the two lead boys, and the supporting cast. An interesting twist on an old story. I have no regrets, I'm sure in the years to come, I will enjoy watching this movie many times.
summary: Love - how can anything that feels so good hurt so much.
